basics.name: Lydia Jun
basics.label: Shidler Undergraduate
basics.summary: I am a junior at the Shidler College of Business studying Finance, International Business, and Management Information Systems. I expect to graduate in Spring 2023.

education.area: Finance, International Business, & Management Information Systems (expected Spring, 2023)

work.company: Office of Enterprise Technology Services, State of Hawaii
highlights: Assist Department of Accounting and General Services and Department of Budget and Finance with financial system modernization effort.
Create accurate, detailed, and up-to-date Treasury and Bond business process diagrams.

work.company: Odo Scholarship Foundation, Next Gen Leaders Program
highlights: Craft solution toward homelessness in Hawaii and contribute toward Hawaii 2.0 Initiative with capstone group and present project proposal to business and community leaders.
Interact with 10+ business leaders and professionals to learn in-depth about various issues affecting Hawaii including climate change, digital globalization, tourism, racism, and homelessness.
Analyzed workflow for commercial underwriting and presented suggestions to department leads on how to make process more efficient and paperless.
Analyzed social media marketing strategy and presented recommendations on how to improve engagement amongst young adults in their 20s and 30s.

Conducted a market scan and researched Hawaii’s business industry to give a final presentation to 30+ company executives and team leads about recommendations targeting underrepresented areas of the company and opportunities for growth.
Communicated with 50+ local businesses and professionals to expand Rho Chi’s network and provide potential professional development opportunities for brothers.
Raised a total of $2,150 in sponsorships by obtaining 7 sponsors for the Fall 2020 semester.
Created a sponsorship packet that marketed Rho Chi sponsorships using graphic design software.
Executed first-ever virtual Mock Interviews, which included 40+ attendees.

awards.title: B+ Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarships awarded to incoming freshmen and continuing students who complete a rigorous high school curriculum with a minimum overall GPA of 3.0 at a Hawai'i public school.

awards.title: First place
awards.summary: My team won first place in 2015.  See my portfolio site for more details.
